columns.text: In this problem, we are asked to indicate the effect of the following scenario on the operating cycle.
**Operating Cycle** refers to the days required for a business to make an initial outlay of cash to produce goods, sell the goods and collect cash from customers.

Let's now indicate the effect of the following scenario on the operating cycle. 

### a. Average receivables goes up.

When the average receivables goes up, it will **increase** the operating cycle. This means customers are delaying their payment which slows cash flow and increases the operating cash flow of the company.

### b.  Credit repayment times for customers are increased.

When credit repayment times for customers are increased, it will **increase** the operating cycle. This means the customers will take longer period of time to pay their credit.

### c. Inventory turnover goes from 3 times to 6 times.

When inventory turnover goes from 3 times to 6 times, it will **decrease** the operating cycle. This indicates that the company is selling things efficiently and that there is a high demand for the product.

### d. Payables turnover goes from 6 times to 11 times.

When payables turnover goes from 6 times to 11 times., it will **not change** the operating cycle because payable period is not part of operating cycle.

### e. Receivables turnover goes from 7 times to 9 times.

When receivables turnover goes from 7 times to 9 times, it will **decrease** the operating cycle. This indicates that the company has the ability to collect accounts receivable quickly.

### f. Payments to suppliers are accelerated.

When payment to suppliers are accelerated,  it will **not change** the operating cycle because payment to suppliers is not part of operating cycle.

Here is the summary of the results:

<center>

||**Answer** | | | **Answer**| 
|:--:|:--:|--|:--:|:--:| 
| a| **I** | |d | **N** | 
| b| **I** | | e| **D** | 
|c | **D** | | f| **N**|
